fields.description:
In Google Chrome (and I think Firefox and possible Internet Explorer), the Calendar Widget no longer shows most of the "issue blocks".  

This seems to have been a result of the design refresh rolled out this week or last week (sorry, it's been a long week).  

Notice in the attachment that most days there are multiple issues but most of the blocks are the same color as the background.  (If you mouse-over, they're there.)

Couldn't find any place in the OnDemand application-wide settings where we might have caused this by selecting a color choice other than the default.  (That is, none of the places where white is selected is not the default.)
fields.summary: Calendar Widget Broken with Upgrade this week

fields.description:
to repro:
have administrator permissions in Jira
open any Jira page
type 'gg'
start typing 'screen': the actions menu lists two items for screen

repros for every option that has a project level and administrator level link.

previous versions of Jira had a helpful label for which of these was the administrator menu item and which was the project menu item.  this was really helpful, and it would be nice to see it return!
fields.summary: administrator label missing from administrator actions menu

fields.description:
In standalone JIRA, if a component has a description the user can mouseover the component and the tooltip says "<component> <description>". In JIRA OnDemand it only shows the component and not the description.

It _does_ show the description when just on the view issue page, though it could be made a bit easier to read... if I have a component called "Foo" with the description "This is a description of component Foo", the tooltop says "Foo This is a description of component Foo". There should be a dash or colon or something to separate the name and description.
fields.summary: Component dropdown when creating and editing issues in JIRA OnDemand doesn't show component description on mouseover

fields.description:
Many user settings map from {{propertyentry.entity_id}} to {{external_entities.id}}, where {{external_entities.id}} represents a user.

It seems the Studio Import does not preserve  users's {{external_entities.id}}: the value is likely to be different after the import. This means that user settings in {{propertyentry}} that map to the original {{external_entities.id}} are orphaned, and the users' settings are reset to defaults.

Affected settings include:
{noformat}
 GH.HasUserCompletedRapidBoardChartIntro
 GH.HasUserCompletedRapidBoardWelcomeMat
 GH.RapidViewSelected
 GREENHOPPER_UP_10000
 GREENHOPPER_UP_10001
 GREENHOPPER_UP_10002
 GREENHOPPER_UP_10003
 GREENHOPPER_UP_10004
 GREENHOPPER_UP_10005
 GREENHOPPER_UP_10006
 GREENHOPPER_UP_10007
 GREENHOPPER_UP_10101
 GREENHOPPER_US_10000
 GREENHOPPER_US_10001
 GREENHOPPER_US_10002
 GREENHOPPER_US_10003
 GREENHOPPER_US_10004
 GREENHOPPER_US_10005
 GREENHOPPER_US_10006
 GREENHOPPER_US_10007
 GREENHOPPER_US_10100
 GREENHOPPER_US_10101
 GREENHOPPER_US_10200
 GREENHOPPER_US_10201
 GREENHOPPER_US_10202
 GREENHOPPER_US_10203
 GREENHOPPER_US_10204
 GREENHOPPER_US_10206
 GREENHOPPER_US_10207
 GREENHOPPER_US_10208
 jira.quick.create.fields
 jira.quick.create.use
 jira.quick.edit.fields
 jira.quick.edit.show.welcome.screen
 jira.quick.edit.use
 jira.user.timezone
 jira.user.whats.new.dont.show.version
 user.avatar.id
 user.default.share.private
 user.issues.per.page
 user.keyboard.shortcuts.disabled
 user.notifications.mimetype
 user.notify.own.changes
 user.show.actions.in.navigator
{noformat}

GREENHOPPER_US_* are greenhopper user settings for projects. GREENHOPPER_UP_* are user-created contexts for classic boards.

The most visible loss is probably the avatar mapping. The avatar files themselves are transferred fine, so the user just needs to select their avatar again.

It might be possible to fix this up in the db, though this hasn't been thoroughly tested. To try, look up the user's original {{external_entities.id}} value for the user in the imported file, e.g. in this case it is 11: {code}<ExternalEntity id="11" name="fred" type="com.atlassian.jira.user.OfbizExternalEntityStore"/>{code}

Then replace settings that map to the old {{external_entities.id}} so that they map to the new value:
{code}
jira=> update propertyentry
  set entity_id=(select id from external_entities where name='fred')                                                               
where
   entity_name='ExternalEntity' and entity_id='11';
UPDATE 1

jira=> select * from propertyentry where entity_name='ExternalEntity';
  id   |  entity_name   | entity_id |  property_key  | propertytype 
-------+----------------+-----------+----------------+--------------
 10424 | ExternalEntity |       113 | user.avatar.id |            3
(1 row)
{code}

A restart might be required before changed take effect. *I'm not sure what will happen if this ends up creating duplicate settings for some users.*
fields.summary: Studio Import loses user settings that map to a user via external_entities.id

fields.description:
If a workflow is created that enters or copies a Value to a custom field before the *{{Creates the issue originally}}* step, the custom field value will be entered and create a value in the database that is not linked to any issue.

This empty issue value causes a nullpointer exception when the user tries to delete the entire custom field.

Steps to reproduce:
# Copy the default JIRA workflow
# Edit the transition from Create Issue to Open.
# Add a Post Function 'Enter Value for Custom field' (this new function will automatically be up top before the 'Creates the Issue Originally)
# Create a new issue with this workflow
# Query the database: {{SELECT * FROM customfieldvalue WHERE customfield = 10302;}} (use your custom field id there)
*Result:*
{noformat}
SELECT * FROM customfieldvalue WHERE customfield = 10302;
  id   | issue | customfield | parentkey |    stringvalue     | numbervalue | textvalue | datevalue | valuetype
-------+-------+-------------+-----------+--------------------+-------------+-----------+-----------+-----------
 10208 |       |       10302 |           | Causing problems!~ |             |           |           |
 10209 | 10307 |       10302 |           | Causing problems!~ |             |           |           |
{noformat}

Note that {{customfieldvalue}} with id 10208 has no Issue linked to it. These are both created after making a single issue.
fields.summary: Entering values into custom fields before the issue is created creates an unlinked custom field value

fields.description:
*Note: tried it again. And now it worked... Strange => so please close it. If I am able to reproduce it in a stabl way I will reopen it again...*




*Note: could also be assigned to" JIRA Agile" - depends on the perspective of this issue*

*Note: it affects Jira onDemand (version 6.2-OD-10 which cannot be selected below...)*

To reproduce it 
# Create project of type "Agile Scrum" with name "TEST" (which will automatically create an agile board with name "TEST" based on a simple filter too)
# Check the filter assigned to that board
=> it's "project = TEST ORDER BY Rank ASC"
# Rename the project to "TEST2"
# Check filter again: it is not changed (still points to "TEST" which is invalid

If there are already issues assigned to your project, the board will later on be empty, the sprints will be shown, but they seem to be empty, and so on...

I know that this is somehow hard to tackle town because it potentially addresses all kind of filters, but in this special case the filter is implicitly created (alongs with the board) by JIRA and the user is not aware of the sideeffects he is creating by renaming a project.
fields.summary: Renaming a project leads to invalid filters

fields.description:
The "Copy Value From Field to Field" Post Function copies the value(s) of one field to another field.

Configuring this post-function to copy the value of the 'Security Level' field to the 'Summary' field fails with a strange message.

*Steps to reproduce*

# Add the "Copy Value From Field to Field" post-function to one of your workflow's transition.
#* Source Field: [Security Level|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Configuring+Issue-level+Security]
#* Destination Field: Summary
# Save & Publish the workflow
# Create an issue
# Move it through the workflow until you pass this transition

*Expected behavior*

The issue should go through this transition and the 'Summary' field should take the value of the 'Security Level'. For example, if 'Security Level' is set to *Vendor1*, the 'Summary of the issue should be *Vendor1* after this transition.

*What's actually happening*

The issue goes through this transition but the 'Summary' field is getting populated with this instead:

{noformat}
Summary field is [GenericEntity:SchemeIssueSecurityLevels][id,10203][scheme,10201][description,][name,Vendor1]
{noformat}
fields.summary: Copy Value From Field to Field Post Function - Copy fails for security level

fields.description:
Demonstration: http://screencast.com/t/wZZLWHVY

When adding a comment with around 30 wiki markup links that were invalid (i.e. didn't link to another JIRA issue or an absolute URL) such as "\[test\]", the issue page takes a very long time to load (around one minute).

Valid wiki markup links did not seem to slow things down.

Looking at the SQL log, it appears that the slowness is caused by many propertyentry queries being fired off. The more invalid wiki markup links, the more SQL queries are run. I was only able to see this happen on an instance that was using a certain plugin (the DVCS Connector) that stores a fair bit of data in the propertyentry table, but it seems like it's JIRA's fault that it's doing multiple propertyentry scans rather than the DVCS Connector's.
fields.summary: View issue page loads very slowly when some invalid wiki markup links are present

fields.description:
When a custom field of the 'User Picker' type is created, among its suggestions of users are users without application access.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a custom field of the 'User Picker' type
# Place this field on a screen
# Access the screen with this field
# Start typing a user's name/username without application access
fields.summary: User Picker custom field suggests users without application access

fields.description: When creating a ticket in JIRA, when you select the "Create another" option, the description is not copied from the first ticket.
fields.summary: "Create another" feature does not copy the description

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Go to the issue navigator, Basic search
* Add the resolution date under 'More' button (or any other field of date type)
* Select the "Within the last" option
* The default Unity will be minutes. Try to select a different one
* The option doesn't get selected

Attached screenshot as an example.

Replicated this on Firefox 20.0 on Mac.
fields.summary: Basic search using "Within the last" option not working on Firefox

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. On the issue navigator in list view, click on a search criteria (say Projects) to bring up the drop-down.
2. When the drop-down is open, click on an issue in the search result.

Expected Result:
The Drop-down disappears.

Actual Result:
The drop-down still stays on the view issue page. If the user makes changes to that search criteria and click outside the drop-down, the user is navigated back to the search result, as the search is updated.
fields.summary: The search criteria drop-down on the issue nav do not disappear when moving to a different page.

fields.description:
In JIRA OnDemand, when using the Software Development Workflow Scheme, marking an issue as "Done" leaves the resolution as "Unresolved".


*Steps to reproduce :* 
# Set up a new JIRA project with Project Type as "Software Development"
# Create an issue, click on "Start Progress", click on "Start Review" and then click on "Done".
# Expected : The resolution gets set to resolved.
# Actual situation : The resolution does not change to resolved. It remains unresolved.

*Workaround:*
Modify the Done Transition:
* Manually create a Post Function that sets the Resolution field to Done. 
* Also the Condition that only users with Resolve Issue permission may be missing. Add that Condition as well.
fields.summary: Done status does not set resolution

fields.description: Both DocumentIssueImpl and IssueImpl used to use getKey for the equals and hashcode.  The changes to IssueImpl mean that DocumentIssueImpls and IssueImpls for the same issue are no longer considered equivalent.  Greenhopper specifically ands probably others have used this equivalence check for some time.
fields.summary: DocumentIssueImpl and IssueImpl can no longer be checked for equivalence

fields.description: By default, the limit of the attached file defined by JIRA is 10MB. Under Chrome and Firefox users get warning if the file is beyond the limit. However, in IE8 it does not.
fields.summary: In Internet Explorer 8, the Issue Collector does not warn users that the attached file is too big

fields.description:
When the Issue Collector form appears, it will ask for the field's Name and Email if there is no active JIRA session.
!fields.png|thumbnail!

When there is an active JIRA user, it will display _We've currently got you logged in as System Administrator. This feedback will be created using this user unless this is not you._
!admin.png|thumbnail!

If the user clicks on the _not you_ link, it supposes to show the Name and Email fields. However, these fields are missing:
!missing.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue Collector fields (Name and Email) are missing upon canceling the current logged in user's session

fields.description:
GreenHopper adds an option to JIRA's profile menu called "Use Agile by Default". Once this is turned on, there's additional options in the menu to choose between Dashboard, Administration, Issue Navigator, and Agile.

This is broken in OnDemand... the menu heading that should say "Set my JIRA home to" says instead "my.jira.home.section.label" and all four links underneath it give Tomcat 404 errors.
fields.summary: "Set my JIRA home to" functionality in JIRA user menu is broken in OnDemand

fields.description:
When selecting "Allow all statuses to transition to this one" on a workflow transition, the destination status of the transition ends up being able to transition back to itself indefinitely. 

A status should not be able to transition to itself even with "Allow all statuses to transition to this one" checked.
fields.summary: Current workflow status should now allow itself to be transitioned to

fields.description:
If a mail handler to create issues via email is set up, and the default reporter of the mail handler doesn't have permission to create an issue, the message gets rejected, but the pcounter for that particular project is increased. This ends up having large gaps between issues keys, and no relevant information is shown to the administrators, except looking at the debug logs.

If the message is rejected, the pcounter shouldn't be updated.
fields.summary: Message rejected by the mail handler causes the project pcounter to be increased, but no issue is created

fields.description:
*Reproduction Steps* # Create a Message Custom Field (view or edit) # Set the above created custom field's default value with HTML input - e.g. {code}

This is heading 1

{code} *What Happens* Message field is rendered instead in text, not rendered in HTML. When you click edit (to configure the value for the message custom field), the html tag input has not been properly escaped. E.g. in the above example, the default value for the message custom field is as follows: {code}

<h1>This is heading 1</h1>

{code}

fields.description:
In the Activity Stream section of the JIRA Dashboard page, web links are appearing as invalid after editing an issue and adding a link.

h4. How to reproduce issue:
----
- Create a JIRA issue
- Click the More button within that issue then choose Link
- Add a URL link (Web link)
- Go to the Dashboard and look at the Activity Stream

The web link in the activity stream is correct, however the issue link adds an additional string breaking the issue URL and causing a 404 if clicked.

Adds a string at the end of the issue URL like:
{code}
$uriProvider.getIssueUri($issue).toASCIIString()
{code}

Tested on OnDemand JIRA current version.
fields.summary: Web links on the 'Activity Stream' are broken

fields.description:

The one on the top of the page highlights which page number we're currently seeing, however, the one on the bottom of the page does not highlight the number of the page.

Steps to reproduce:
# Add more than 20 users to JIRA
# Go to the 'Application Access' screen
# Compare the two (top and bottom) page indicators
fields.summary: Bottom page indicator on the 'Application Access' screen does not indicates which page number I'm in

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# In Issue Navigator (list view), add the 'Sprint' or 'Epic Link' column
# Drag and drop it to another position

h4. Results
The column simply disappears, instead of being displayed in the new position. Oddly enough, any other columns seem to behave just fine.

This is also replicable for the "Linked Issues" field.

{panel}
h4. Workaround
You can work with the columns in Excel.
# Create a filter using the columns, including Sprint and Epic Link. 
# Export the filter to Excel
# Sort the columns using Excel

Using Epic Link in a spreadsheet at least lets you group your items by epic using data filters. But that is all outside of JIRA, unfortunately. 

(!) Make sure you don't try to move the column before your export to Excel.
{panel}
fields.summary: Sprint and Epic Link columns disappear while moving them (drag and drop) in issue navigator

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Create a user called *reporter* and add it only to the *users* group
* Grant the permission *Assignable User* to the group *developers*
* Add a post function to a given transition in the workflow: *Assign to Reporter*
* Login as the *reporter* user and create an issue
* Then, login as another user with Administrative permissions and execute the given transition
* The issue will be assigned to the reporter, even if the user doesn't have the Assignable User permission (or if the user doesn't belong to any groups or have application access)

Also, we've tried to use [Workflow Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Workflow+Properties]: jira.permission.* but it also didn't help, the post function is executed every time, no matter the user permissions.
fields.summary: Assign to Reporter post function ignores permission scheme

fields.description:

If the same user doesn't have 'Browse Users' permission, they are not able to search by full names in the 'Issue Navigator', which is an expected behavior since the user doesn't have the appropriate permission, *however*, they are able to select all the users in the instance by typing their 'usernames' instead of their full names.

Is this an intended behavior?
fields.summary: Strange behavior with 'Browse Users' permission

fields.description:
After using the Studio importer, many services are missing until the instance is restarted (at which point they are recreated by lifecycle tasks).

The problem appears to be in {{com.atlassian.studio.jira.importer.impl.service.ServiceMaintainerImpl}}: it is designed to strip out unwanted services that may be pulled in by an import. 

This is achieved by removing any services present after an import that aren't in a hardcoded whitelist. It is invoked as part of the postImportStudify() step.

However, it looks like the whitelist is out of date. This impacts JIRA Enterprise hosted to OnDemand migrations. Details here: https://sdog.jira.com/browse/JSTDEV-1968
fields.summary: Valid services are deleted after a Studio Import

fields.description:
"This Tuesday" appears to be incorrectly identified as "Last Tuesday". See attached screenshot.

Today is Friday 2013-Aug-02. As of now and according to my understanding of relative dates, "last Tuesday" was the Tuesday before this week's Tuesday, i.e. 2013-Jul-23. JIRA seems to be identifying 2013-Jul-30 as "last Tuesday", which I would normally call "this Tuesday" because it is the Tuesday that falls in the current week. 

I find relative date identifiers in JIRA to be inconvenient because they make me look at a calendar or wait for hover text to find out the specific date something happened on, when it should be an effortless thing. Dates are intrinsic to what JIRA does - the management of work over time - and they need to be unambiguous and easy to interpret. 

I just took a straw poll of three adjacent Atlassians. Two of us thought "last Tuesday" was 2013-Jul-23 and two of us thought it was 2013-Jul-30. 

I think it is a good idea to remove relative date identifiers entirely and use specific dates instead.
fields.summary: Relative date identifier incorrect in an issue's Activity tab

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a custom field called 'Contact Email Address' - Text Field (< 255 characters)
# Place the field on the 'Default' screen
# Create 3 different issues on a project with the following content on the custom field
#* test@test.com
#* test@test.edu
#* test@test.org
# Go to the Issue Navigator
# Run the following queries
#* "Contact Email Address" !~ "com"
#* "Contact Email Address" !~ "edu"
#* "Contact Email Address" !~ "org"
# As the result, in all the searches, JIRA will return the three issues

h3. Expected behavior

It should be returning only 2 issues in each one of the searches. Because it should not be displaying the one with specified domain.

As per the [Advanced Searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-DOES_NOT_CONTAIN] documentation, this should be working.

Similar issues occur when using the CONTAINS operator as well.
fields.summary: JQL returns unexpected results when field being searched on contains an email address

fields.description:
In the new versions of JIRA (after 6.0 to be more exact), changing the workflow scheme of a project has a different behavior than previous versions (JIRA 5.2.11). When performing the 2nd step of the process, in the new versions, all issue types are listed there, even the ones not present in the project.

The cause of this to happen is the "All Unassigned Issue Types" option that cannot be removed when setting up the workflows in a workflow scheme.

In JIRA 5.2.11, you can remove the "All Unassigned Issue Types" from the mapping and leave only the issue types you want:

!jira52.png!

And from JIRA 6.0 on, you can no longer remove that option:

!jira6.png!
fields.summary: Switching workflow scheme of a project has a different behavior in newer versions

*Steps to reproduce:*
# in Jira go to Projects -> Import External Project
# Select 'Import from Bitbucket'
# Click 'Next' on the Bitbucket Setup
# Log in to Bitbucket (if you are not already)
# Grant access ( error is displayed )

*Note:*

fields.description:
The Atlassian Support Tools plugin which is bundled with our BTF versions of JIRA, will get disabled when importing an OnDemand instance from xml.

*Workaround*
The plugin only has been disabled, it is still present on the instance. You can enable it again through "Manage Add-ons"

The screen-shot attached, have a closer look at the drop down menu. 

*Workaround*
Downgrade Chrome to version 29.

* Hit submit and you'll land on the projects default page
* Go to create another project, you'll phail
* Going to create another project form there, will result in success

fields.description:
When choosing the groups for a single user to join, searching the list closes the window. Steps to reproduce:

Login to an ondemand instance
Go to the global users admin option
Click 'Groups' next to a users name
Highlight in the available groups box
Type a letter to search

The box closes not allowing you to search.
fields.summary: Group List Closes When Trying to Search It

fields.description: For long time we were using twitter's deprecated API. Resource we were using - https://dev.twitter.com/docs/api/1/get/search - has disappeared. We are supposed to use https://dev.twitter.com/docs/api/1.1/get/search/tweets now
fields.summary: JIRA wallboard Twitter gadget doesn't work again

fields.description: On the latest OnDemand release, when opening an Excel export, the Status field column is duplicated and shows: 'OpenOpen' or similar, on each row. Expected: 'Open', just once. (Export created from the Issue List View by doing Export -> Excel (all Fields) ) *Reason:* This is caused by the new Status Icon added. The Icon cannot be loaded and some programs like Office Standard 2010 Excel that will display the Alternative text (alt="Open") which causes the duplicate. {code} Open {code} *Related to:* [JRA-34532 - When doing an export from JIRA the report is inserting unwanted images|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34532] This issue is different because it can be fixed by removing the 'alt' text in the image tag without removing the Images. (Tested manually and Confirmed) *Workaround:* No Workaround at the moment other than using another program to view the Export Excel file.
fields.summary: Jira export to Excel shows duplicate status field

fields.description:
When searching a user with full username characters breaks the result.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create user with username: rgee, test
# g+g Group, select any Group (Example: administrator)
# Add/Remove Users
# On *Add members to selected group(s)
# Type rgee, you will noticed no matching users returned
# However, if you type rge instead, there are matching result
# Type test, same result obtained

(Typing speed will differ the result, if the result is returned before you finish typing, it will not show the problem)

*Additional Information*
* This does *NOT* happen on the Assignee field and Reporter field
* Checked the project role and it is *NOT* affected as well
* Tested consistent throughout supported browsers (Firefox 19.0.2, Chrome Version 26.0.1410.43 m and IE9)

!errorgroupsearch.JPG!
fields.summary: Searching For User in Bulk Edit Group Members Breaks the Result

Could not find what you were looking for. Maybe you should raise an issue.
Go to JIRA home
{quote}

Current Version in OnDemand: 6.0-OD-11
fields.summary: "What's new" option shows an error message

fields.description:
We are using Jira/Greenhopper OnDemand, and have many users on IE8 with the Chrome Frame plugin. Untill recently, that worked fine. In one of the latest versions, however, IE8+CF users could no longer open issues or view issue filters. This seems to have happened within the last month or so.

Whenever a user clicks an issue link, such as "https://<domain>/browse/ALA-1922", the user is redirected to a URL similar to "https://<domain>/i#browse/ALA-2019?issueKey=ALA-2019&serverRenderedViewIssue=true", which renders an empty search page (see attached)

Simarly for filters, when a user follows a link to a pre-defined filter such as "https://<domain>/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=10003" by clicking a link in the "Issues" menu, the user is redirected to a URL similar to "https://<domain>/i#issues/?filter=10003", with an empty search page (see attached).

This makes Jira/Greenhopper a lot less useful to us, since most of our user base can no longer navigate to issues via links or use filters. 

We expect to be able to use Jira/Greenhopper in IE8 with Chrome Frame installed, so we request that the issue is fixed either by removing the <meta> tag that enables Chrome Frame in Jira OnDemand, or by fixing the issue in Chrome Frame, so issue and filter links render correctly.
fields.summary: Jira/Greenhopper OnDemand doesn't work with Chrome Frame

fields.description:
The workflow created using the Simple Issue Tracking template has the wrong Condition for transitioning to DONE:
* Only users with Assignable User permission can execute this transition.

When in fact, according to common sense, it should be:
* Only users with Resolve Issue permission can execute this transition.

To reproduce:
Create a new Project using the Simple Issue Tracking Workflow and look at the Done transitions (21) and (41)

Notes:
* This Condition is later deleted along with the 'Set Resolution' post-condition and is addressed on issue [JRA-36324|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36324]
fields.summary: Simple Issue Tracking Workflow has wrong Transition Condition

fields.description:
If an OnDemand customer import a backup from BTF JIRA, currently all Applinks are deleted by UalTerminator.

I think it should only delete applinks that are configured to use trusted application authentication, and should not delete application links that are configured to use OAuth.

Additionally, if the link being deleted is already deleted by other components, especially during app status change caused by license loading, UalTerminator should handle it gracefully and continue deleting other applinks instead of throwing a RuntimeException and abort the import process.
fields.summary: UalTerminator used for OnDemand Import should only terminate applinks with trusted app authentication and should be more robust

fields.description:
When using Google Chrome v21.x, the dropdown menus are not shown in the navigation bar. 
*Only legacy Studio instances are affected by this behavior.*
fields.summary: Dropdown menus in navigation bar are not shown in Chrome v21.x

fields.description:
- *Reproduce Steps*
1. From the *main menu* ->*Issues* -> *My Open Issues*
2. All assigned issues to current user are displayed
3. Select 1 issue, *More* -> *Log Work* then enter some values.
4. Upon clicking *Log*, the filter is displayed as *No issues were found to match your search*
5. Click on *My Open Issues* on the left or reload the page, then all issues are displayed normally.

This bug occurs with all type of filters.

- *Behavior*

The time is logged accordingly but  the filter is displayed as *No issues were found to match your search*.

- *Expected Outcome*
Filter should not display *No issues were found to match your search*, instead it should list down all issues normally.
fields.summary: Logging work causes filter to be empty

It seems that you have tried to perform an illegal workflow operation.
{quote}

fields.description:
When making a comment on an issue and the noformat tag is used all of the space before is removed. To recreate:

Go to a JIRA instance and make a comment
Input some text and then hit enter several times
Use the noformat tag with some text in between
When you preview it will only show 1 space before was input and when you save it it shows no spaces were input
fields.summary: {noformat} macro is removing space above when saved

fields.description:
JIRA import can fail in OD during re-indexing with a message like the one below in the logs. 

The problem is that 2 re-indexes are kicked off in parallel when the upgrade tasks run during the import. One is triggered by {{UT055UseDefaultPaths}} in a new thread, and the other is triggered by  {{UT066StripCustomSearchFieldDescriptions}} in the import thread, which leads to a race condition.

Both re-index jobs [identify a message from a prior re-index|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/issue/index/DefaultIndexManager.java#312] to be deleted, but the first wins the [race to delete of the message|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/issue/index/DefaultIndexManager.java#349], such that when the second attempts to do so, it [fails with the NPE here|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/config/DefaultReindexMessageManager.java#211].

I suspect the parallel triggered by {{UT055UseDefaultPaths}} is unnecessary.

fields.description:
Today I came across a problem reported by a customer that was caused by stale data in Tomcat's work directory.

Their workflow transition editor was still the old version instead of the new one (involving the new workflow designer stuff), and wasn't working properly. Clearing the Tomcat work directory fixed it, but we wasted a lot of Support, QA and dev time trying to figure out the problem.

Had we cleared it on upgrade, the customer never would have run into the problem.

Is it OK for the icebat to be modified to always clear Tomcat's work directory on upgrade? Or is there a more correct way to deal with this class of problem?
fields.summary: Investigate whether we should clear JIRA OnDemand's Tomcat work directory after every upgrade

fields.description:
Jira OnDemand, under Issues, when using the Detail View and viewing a certain issue. The All, Comments, History, Activity and Commits tabs work in a certain way - upon click the content of the tab is loaded through AJAX. The Transitions Summary tab redirects to the issue page instead. This is not the expected behaviour as it should be consistent with the rest of the tabs. It also disrupts the workflow.

Version is the latest OnDemand, on the About JIRA says v6.0-OD-15. I could only find 6.0-OD-14 in the Affects Version dropdown so I added the 6.0.1/OD-15 choice, not sure if it's the correct one.
fields.summary: Transitions tab in Detail View

fields.description:
After the customer reported being unable to load the classic editor we tested on a couple of instances.
Test steps:
# Load workflow in browser
# Go to diagram mode
# Click the "Classic Workflow" link
# Page renders improperly

This was tested only on an OnDemand instance of JIRA against IE8 and IE9 on XP and Win7. One test each, so it's possible local settings are interfering.
fields.summary: Classic workflow editor doesn't render in IE8 or IE9

fields.description:
APL ticket: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-998

After upgrading to JIRA 6.0-RC1, applications links may sometimes show in the application links administration screen as appearing to be offline and requiring relocation. The message is "Application 'example applink' seems to be offline. Click here to Relocate."

The applinks continue to work despite this message.
Walking through the relocation sequence will sometimes but not always cause the message to go away.
fields.summary: Application links administration erroneously shows applinks as needing relocation
